item.title: Strangers' Reunion cafe introduces new menu items
item.description: Source: Strangers’ Reunion. Ocean Trout on Hash. If you’re searching for a new lunch spot, you might want to try Strangers’ Reunion, a cafe in Singapore’s Kampong Bahru district that recently updated its menu. World Gourmet Summit-recognized chef Daniel Chin has crafted dishes with a minimum of five components to entice your taste buds. The cafe is well-known for its coffee, which is chosen and curated by Ryan Tan, a three-time Singapore Barista Champion and Co-founder of Strangers’ Reunion.

item.title: Starbucks Indonesia has launched the Starbucks Mobile App
item.description: Source: Starbucks. Use the mobile app to make purchases at Starbucks. Starbucks Indonesia has launched its mobile app, offering customers a quick and easy way to pay at over 260 stores across the country. Expanding upon the cashless Starbucks Card system introduced in 2013, the Starbucks Indonesia mobile app (available on iPhone and Android) allows customers to pay for purchases by scanning a barcode linked to their registered Starbucks Card.
